info.name: Habenular nuclei
info.description: The habenular nuclei are small nuclei located on the dorsomedial aspect of the caudal thalamus. They receive afferents from septal nuclei, preoptic area, etc. via the stria medullaris of the thalamus and send efferents to reticular nuclei of the midbrain via the habenulointerpeduncular tracdt. They are part of limbic system circuits but their function is unclear.
